High Crime.definition: a crime of infamous nature contrary to public morality but not technically constituting a felony ;specif

1.1: a crime of infamous nature contrary to public morality but not technically constituting a felony

2.1: an offense that the U.S. Senate deems to constitute an adequate ground for removal of the president, vice president, or any civil officer as a person unfit to hold public office and deserving of impeachment
